title: The logarithmic nature of the CO2 greenhouse effect
Ask HN: Recommend CS topics for non-English, non-technical people?
text:
The aim is not to make them masters in CS, but to give them enough knowledge in layperson's terms so that they are confident about computers and don't think it as magic.

For example, what happens when a user presses a key, how are simple characters displayed on screen, how are colours represented in a computer, how are images displayed, how is a string searched in a text file, how are entries in a spreadsheet column sorted, how computer does binary maths etc.

What topics do you recommend that will be more beneficial to a layperson who is non-technical and do not speak English?

Ask HN: How to survive for a long time in one organization?
text:
I work in organization for a long time (8+ years) and I really like it. I had a good growth path, and it's still exciting.

But my problem is that similar to memory leak, I'm facing with the time leak. I spend a lot of time on meetings, or provide support to systems that nobody else knows about. Some of the I wrote, some of them I just get known and I left alone.

It's hard to get rid of that legacy baggage, so that I think a "fresh start" will be the only option to get some air - but it's almost impossible to stay in one company and have a fresh start.

If you are for a long time on one company: How did you survive? How do you optimize your time?
